title: Fight Back Against Psoriasis by Managing Stress

content: Over the years, my reactions to my psoriasis have been somewhat linked to the way I manage my stress levels. For instance, if my stress levels are high and left unattended to, I am likely to experience more inflammation, irritation, and discomfort.
Allow me to share some of my most impactful methods for managing stress and minimizing the effects of psoriasis.
Taking time to write is great for our mental health because it’s uninterrupted thinking without anyone else’s input.

Problem-solving on your own is so crucial if you want to be able to stand on your own two feet and work things out on your own. We may share things with someone we care about and trust deeply, but they won’t always say exactly what we need to hear -- and that’s not their fault.

Every internal battle and or struggle isn’t for someone else to fix. We have to do the legwork ourselves, and writing it out is like doing our own research project on how to fix it or at least walk away feeling better.

sections.heading: Try a Side Hustle
content: Time and time again, bills pile up, and we’re left with very little money at the end of the month. This is the problem with working a “stable job” and doing only that. It leads us to live paycheck to paycheck without contributing to savings and investments.

A side hustle gives you more cushion on top of your current income and allows you to have more freedom to spend how you want. Some people want to save 20%, invest 20%, and use the remaining 60% for expenses and personal use.

Having an extra $300 to $400 every month adds up and keeps you on top of your money. If you don’t pick up a side hustle that pays, odds are somebody else will. The extra money in your pockets will provide reassurance and security we all aspire to have.
Running, biking, walking, and hitting the weights are the most common forms of stress relief. Anyone I’ve ever met typically enjoys one of these.

content: If you neglect your physical health, you’re likely to fall into substance abuse, binge eating, binge-watching, and never getting on track.
It’s happened to me. When I stopped running, I started binge-watching shows, movies, YouTube videos, etc. None of it works.
You could watch an inspiring movie 11 times in a row, but unless you take action, you’re not going to see anything change.

Although relieving stress won’t completely eliminate your psoriasis, it will help cut back some of its negative effects. Dating back to my psoriasis diagnosis, it was only a few weeks earlier that I had received my first failing grade. Since that point, I got back on track and never let it phase me again.

Before, I did not have healthy coping techniques for stress. Now that I’m a little older and wiser, I have implemented these strategies and have made noticeable progress. I hope the same goes for you.
